name: Idiopathic Laryngeal Neuropathic Syndrome (ILNS)
chief_complaint: I feel like there's a constant lump in my throat, and it burns when I talk.
symptoms: Globus sensation (feeling of lump in throat)

lab_results.Laryngeal EMG: Increased spontaneous activity in thyroarytenoid muscles

treatment: Voice therapy with laryngeal relaxation techniques
Cognitive behavioral therapy for symptom coping
prognosis: Chronic condition requiring long-term management. 60% of patients achieve significant symptom reduction with multimodal therapy, but complete resolution is rare.
description: ILNS is a recently characterized disorder involving hypersensitivity of the superior laryngeal nerve branches without identifiable structural pathology. Thought to represent a form of peripheral laryngeal neuropathy, it shares features with other functional neurologic disorders but with specific laryngeal localization. Diagnosis requires exclusion of other causes of chronic laryngeal symptoms.
risk_factors: History of viral upper respiratory infections
History of acid reflux (though not causative)
